recipeMethods.stepInstructions:
1. Turn on pasta cooker. After the cooker fills with water, add salt.

2. Set timer to 8 - 10 mintues.

3. Place 5 lbs of pasta in each pasta basket. Place basket in pasta 
cooker and press "Cook" button.

4. When the pasta drops into the water, stir the pasta a couple of times
so the pasta doesn't stick.

5. When the pasta is cooked and rises from the water, check for 
doneness, until al dente.

6. Place pasta from each basket onto a sheet pan (one basket per sheet 
pan). 

7. Using heat resistant gloves, evenly distribute pasta on sheet pan.

8. Add 1/2 cup of oil per sheet pan. Toss oil with pasta so that pasta 
is lightly coated.

9. Place pasta under fans for 10 minutes to cool.

10. Pasta can be left on sheet pans or placed in lexan containers. Pasta
can be left at room temperature for up to 4 hours. Otherwise, place 
pasta in cooler until ready for use.

1. Fill tilt kettle with water. Boil water.

2. When water comes to a boil, add salt.

3. Place 5 lbs of pasta in each pasta basket. 

4. Place baskets of pasta in the pasta tilt kettle (up to 2 baskets at a
 time). Cook for 8 - 10 minutes, until pasta is al dente.

5. Remove pasta from water, shaking basket to remove excess water.

6. Place pasta from each basket onto a sheet pan (one basket per sheet 
pan).

7. Using heat resistant gloves, evenly distribute pasta on sheet pan.

8. Add 1/2 cup of oil per sheet pan. Toss oil with pasta so that pasta 
is lightly coated.

9. Place pasta under fans for 10 minutes to cool.

10. Pasta can be left on sheet pans or placed in lexan containers. Pasta
can be left at room temperature for up to 4 hours. Otherwise, pasta 
should be placed in cooler until ready for use.


Note: After cooking 5 batches of pasta, water will need to be "skimmed" 
or replaced.

Using the pasta cooker, press the "skim" button.
Using a tilt kettle, remove 1/4 of the water and replace with fresh 
water.
